          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["When an option requires an argument, "],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [" places that argument into the variable "],
              ["OPTARG", [["c"]]],
              [". The shell does not reset "],
              ["OPTIND", [["c"]]],
              [
                " automatically; it must be manually reset between multiple calls to "
              ],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [
                " within the same shell invocation if a new set of parameters is to be used."
              ]
            ]
          },

            "title": [
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [" can report errors in two ways. If the first character of "],
              ["optstring", [["c"]]],
              [" is a colon ("],
              [":", [["c"]]],
              [

            "title": [
              ["OPTIND", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is set to the index of the first non-option argument, and name is set to "
              ],
              ["?", [["c"]]],
              [". "],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [
                " normally parses the positional parameters, but if more arguments are given in "
              ],
              ["args", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [" parses those instead."]

          },

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["If a required argument is not found, and "],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [" is not silent, a question mark ("],
              ["?", [["c"]]],
              [") is placed in "],
              ["name", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["OPTARG", [["c"]]],
              [" is unset, and a diagnostic message is printed. If "],
              ["getopts", [["c"]]],
              [" is silent, then a colon ("],
              [":", [["c"]]],
              [") is placed in name and "],
              ["OPTARG", [["c"]]],
              [" is set to the option character."]

              ["OPTIND", [["c"]]],
              [" is initialized to "],
